mechanoreception.notes: As flatworms, Chimaerocestidae likely possess basic mechanoreception capabilities to detect touch and movement in their environment.

chemoreception.notes: As parasitic flatworms, Chimaerocestidae likely rely on chemoreception to locate hosts and suitable attachment sites within the host. This is a common sensory modality in parasitic worms.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreceptors in Chimaerocestidae is currently unknown. Many parasitic flatworms lack eyespots or other photoreceptive organs, especially those residing in dark environments within their hosts.
